topic: How to type-check batch jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to type-check batch jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Type-Checking Batch Jobs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+, to type-check batch jobs and ensure data validity.",
  "key_points": [
    "Define your FastAPI application and endpoints",
    "Leverage Pydantic models for data validation",
    "Handle asynchronous processing using FastAPI's built-in features or external libraries like Uvicorn and aiohttp",
    "Use dependencies to manage job execution context"
  ],
  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends\n\
from pydantic import BaseModel\n\
from typing import List\n\
app = FastAPI()\n\n\
class Job(BaseModel):\n    data: List[int]\n\n@app.post('/jobs/')\nasync def create_job(job: Job, my_dependency: str = Depends(get_my_dep)):\n    # Handle the job using async context\n    ...\n```"
    },
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse\n\n@app.post('/jobs/')\nasync def create_job(request):\n    job = Job(**request.json())\n    # Handle the job using async context\n    return JSONResponse({'message': 'Job created.'})\n    ```"
    }
  ],
  "version_notes": [
    "Python 3.12+ is required for using type hints and async/await syntax",
    "FastAPI version 0.71.0 or later is recommended for this example"
  ],
  "caveats": [
    "This example assumes you have a basic understanding of FastAPI, Pydantic, and asynchronous programming in Python",
    "Ensure that your development environment has the necessary packages installed"
  ]
}
